ISSUE.TITLE: [discuss]: how to make the annotations in the config-default.yaml file clearer
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: # Description: Currently, the annotations style in the config-default.yaml file is very misleading, for example: ```yaml router: http: 'radixtree_uri' # radixtree_uri: match route by uri(base on radixtree) # radixtree_host_uri: match route by host + uri(base on radixtree) # radixtree_uri_with_parameter: like radixtree_uri but match uri with parameters, # see https://github.com/api7/lua-resty-radixtree/#parameters-in-path for # more details. ssl: 'radixtree_sni' # radixtree_sni: match route by SNI(base on radixtree) # stream_proxy: # TCP/UDP proxy # tcp: ``` This annotations style is easy to understand that `stream_proxy` is at the same level as `ssl`, but `stream_proxy` is at the same level as `router`. I think we need a better way of annotation to make it easier for users to understand the hierarchical relationship before them. what do you think?

COMMIT.MESSAGE: docs: avoid the misleading comment Also remove helpless yaml lint. Fix #3962 Signed-off-by: spacewander <spacewanderlzx@gmail.com>
